name: Nektarios Georgios Tsoutsos
content: Nektarios Georgios Tsoutsos Home Publications Research Advisees Teaching Service Misc Nektarios Georgios Tsoutsos Nektarios Georgios Tsoutsos, Ph.D. Associate Professor, University of Delaware Co-Director, FinTech Innovation Hub Associate Director, Center for Cybersecurity, Assurance, and Privacy Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering 139 The Green, Evans Hall, Newark, DE 19716 Department of Computer and Information Sciences 18 Amstel Ave, Smith Hall, Newark, DE 19716 FinTech Innovation Hub 591 Collaboration Way, FinTech Innovation Hub, Newark, DE 19713 Office: 201F Evans Hall [Map] Phone: (302) 831–6655 Email: lastname at udel dot edu [PGP] Vita I am an associate professor in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of Delaware, with a joint appointment in the Department of Computer and Information Sciences. As of 2021, I am also associate director at the Center for Cybersecurity, Assurance, and Privacy at UD, and as of September 2024, I am a co-director of UD's FinTech Innovation Hub. Since May 2025, I am also a member of the Delaware Cyber Security Advisory Council, and a senior member of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE). My research interests are in cybersecurity and applied cryptography, with a special focus in hardware security, trustworthy computing, and privacy outsourcing. I have received the Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from New York University, and the M.Sc. degree in Computer Engineering from Columbia University. Before joining UD, I was a postdoctoral researcher at NYU where I have been developing secure architectures for private and trustworthy processing of sensitive information using homomorphic encryption. While at NYU, I have also spent time at Intel and the Security Center of Excellence in Hillsboro, OR. Honors and Awards National Science Foundation (NSF) CAREER Award from the Secure & Trustworthy Cyberspace program Recognition: Delaware's 15 Most Influential Business Leaders by the Delaware News Journal (2023) University of Delaware Research Foundation (UDRF) Award in 2021 New York University Ph.D. Student Fellowship for the duration of doctoral studies Pearl Brownstein Doctoral Research Award for doctoral research showing the greatest promise (NYU) Deborah Rosenthal Award for outstanding performance on the Ph.D. Qualification Exam (NYU) 1st Place Award at CSAW Embedded Security Challenge '13 for the design of stealthy hardware Trojan horses to bypass the protections of FANCI (CCS '13) Advisee Honor: 1st Place Award at CSAW Embedded Security Challenge '18 for designing robust covert channels to exfiltrate sensitive data using IoT smart bulbs (C.
